name: breadcrumbs production | breadcrumbs | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20281/documentation

This activity represents the production of breadcrumbs in an ingredient and food additive processing plant. The flour used for the breadcrumbs is obtained from conventional wheat production. The wheat is then grinded at a milling plant  to produce wheat flour and thereafter it is transported by trucks to an ingredient and food additive processing plant, where the breadcrumbs are procuded. Breadcrumbs are made up of 90% wheat flour, and less than 5% content of corn dextrose, sunflower oil, salt, yeast and spices.

Activities include the production of all raw materials to produce the breadcrumbs, the grinding of wheat at a milling plant and the production of the final product.

The transport of breadcrumbs beyond the gate of the ingredient and food additive plants were not included in the modelling. The amount of plastic used in packagin, not included in the database, is 1.41 grams per kilogram of breadcrumbs production.
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/106:Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products/1061:Manufacture of grain mill products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The breadcrumbs processing plant is located in NW Spain, but its products are exported throughout Europe. The wheat grain is produced in the Ukraine and transported by marine freight to the port of Santander, in northern Spain. Thereafter, the wheat is sent to a mill in the province of Palencia (Spain) to produce the flour, which is then transported to the city fo Vigo to the breadcrumb processing factory.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Technology represents business as usual in Europe for this type of product.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Reference for breadcrumb production in Europe.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data collection was performed directly with the company that processed the final products. Data from upstream processes were described by plant technicians based on data exhanged with other companies providing materials.
